sen.e: After returned to Japan, he successively played a role of the chief priest of Manju-ji Temple in Bungo Province and Kichijo-ji Temple in Kozuke Province.

sen.e: Thereafter, he gained the embrace of Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, the third Shogun, and was invited to Kamakura Engaku-ji Temple and Kencho-ji Temple, but he firmly declined these invitations and resided at Ryogan-ji Temple in Kasama district, Hitachi Province.
